pageTitle: Driver Marcus Ericsson bringing $15.5 million to Caterham Formula One team | Autoweek
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {2896=While the popular, experienced and feisty Kamui Kobayashi can put just $1 million of his fans' money on the table, and agree to drive for free in 2014, the lesser-known Ericsson has been referred to as a fully-fledged 'pay driver. Until now, the amount of his backing has not been clear., 3636=Marcus Ericsson is reportedly bringing $15.5 million to Caterham to secure his ride for 2014. Photo by LAT PHOTOGRAPHIC, 4201=January 22, 2014}
textBeforeTable: 2015 Formula One Schedule --> Comments See MoreFormula One By GMM Kulta said Ericsson, 23, has compiled the backing with the aid of well-known former Indy-car driver driver and fellow Swede Kenny Brack. Finnish correspondent Heikki Kulta cited sources in reporting that Ericsson is bringing 100 million Swedish Krona, or a little more than $15.5 million (U.S.), to Caterham.
